Reviews.Title: “Treat yoursel at Hullett House - Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: marie-josee m
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hullett House after a cruise in China and Vietnam. This small hotel is a must in Hong Kong. It is perfectly located and is probably the only hotel to have balcony where you can enjoy the view. The room was large, nicely decorated and quiet. The service was professional. The quality of the breakfast was also at the level of the hotel. What we liked the most about the Hullett House was the fact that there is only a dozen of rooms / suites. Nothing compared to the huge hotels you find in Hong Kong. A bit expensive but worthy.

Reviews.Title: “A treat!”
Reviews.Author: Ursula6815
Reviews.Content: If you want to appreciate central Hong Kong without feeling vertigo every step you take this place is for you. Fantastic views of the skyline, easy access to downtown Hong Kong and the Island. Beautiful, relaxing hotel with pretty terrace. A home from home, except the bed was pretty hard. There is lots of character, fantastic service, treats left in your room every night and each room is different. Had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: DrMikeDallas
Reviews.Content: After two hectic weeks scurrying around China we celebrated our anniversary with s three day stay at Hullett House. The ambiance was quietly upscale with a caring professionalism. (the Guest Services Manager walked us to our neighborhood restaurant one evening.) Twelve unique rooms in this slightly quirky historical update of the 1880's British marine police headquarters. Wonderful meals in two of the five restaurants. Has to be one of the very best on HK.

Reviews.Title: “Much Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Aaron-Orupe
Reviews.Content: My expectations were high for his property considering its location and rate to which I was highly disappointed from the beginning but kept wandering if things would improve - sadly the best part of my experience was the airport car at departure which I had to pay for on top of everything else. The location is magnificent although what would be even better is a HK skyline view ... again the price warrants it. Check-in was very faulty towers-like as was check-out but all I wanted was the balcony to which I had two private balconys in a corner suite and although comfortable they needed cleaning because they looked like they hadn't been hosed down in years! Ultimately there's a reason why, for what you pay to stay here this property isn't in the top 10 ranking, and needs major improvements service wise to be considered a leading hotel of the world. Sadly I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential but not there yet”
Reviews.Author: Jasonleg
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at Hullett House in Hong Kong. Arrived at the entrance that was e-mailed to me. There was no one there and if you don't read the really small sign telling you to call up when you arrive on the 1st floor you will not be able to check in at reception. The hotel is in a historic building and it really is quite an experience as this was the old police headquarters which have been converted into a heritage centre. The building has been left intact including the old stairs and facade. When you walk down to the restaurant along the narrow passageway you can't help thinking of the history that the walls hold. First the good: the bed is amazing in the Stanley Suite, it is comfortable and you can just melt into sleep. The balcony with your private sitting area is also spectacular as you have partial views of the Hong Kong skyline. There is also a free mini bar service and free wifi. The amenities in the bathroom are comprehensive and smell divine. However, there are many things which need improvement. Now the improvements: The key card was a used one which had the previous guests name tippexed out and ours written in. This is tacky and not something I would expect from this kind of establishment. The room is showing wear and tear and the hotel has not been open for long. The material on one of the chairs has ripped and the tap in the bathroom is missing the hot sign. There is a sense that you are not actually in a hotel and there is no list of services that the hotel offers. The rooms are vacuous and the space has not been used well which makes you feel like you are sleeping in a cave rather than in a cosy heritage room. The actual hotel is not user friendly and the flow is not pleasant for a guest. Breakfast was pleasant but the service in the restaurant was disappointing. The waiter did not smile once or even attempt to be friendly. For those wanting privacy this is a good hotel. But when the rate is the same as the Peninsula and I compare what you get just one block away, I am sorry to say that I would rather stay at the Peninsula than here.

Reviews.Title: “Police Headquarters into a spectacular hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billy W
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong loves demolishing its heritage buildings, so the the Victorian-era marine police headquarters at the tip of the Kowloon peninsula being made into a hotel is a welcome development. Hullett House has five restaurants each one is wonderful. The massive suites are a bit sparse but magnificent, with little more than a bed, wooden floorboards, a wall-mounted TV and a fireplace. MainlWe stayed in the Casam suite, which is hung with modern art, and the white Silvermine. Breakfast on the veranda of The Parlour - overlooking banyan trees, historical artifacts and the shopping plaza beneath the hotel - is a great start to the day. Hullett House would be a rarity in any part of the world: surrounded by high-rise, hi-tech Hong Kong, it's an unexpected treasure.

Reviews.Title: “a great idea beautifully executed”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Stanley Suite, which was gorgeous - a large room with high ceilings, wooden floorboards, a king size bed, large outdoor terrace and fabulous decor. We also tried out the cantonese restaurant, Loong Toh Yuen, which i highly recommend - the food was great but the chinoiserie interior is what really sold it for me. Hullett House thoroughly deserves its Hot Pink rating on the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Robertsconsulting
Reviews.Content: The venue, decor, food, service, friendliness of staff and general ambience all an absolute delight! The attention to detail knows no bounds and I plan to return on my next visit to Hong Kong. I cannot recommend it highly enough. A big Thank You to the Hullett House team for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Heritage Hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: AmandaO-HongKong
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated our Anniversary with a stay at Hullett House and were delighted to fine such a rare boutique hotel experience in Hong Kong. This heritage building has been beautifully restored, and with just 10 hotel rooms, each has been designed with a different Asian flavour. Our Lido Suite was decadent black and gold, lovely balcony overlooking the Cultural Center, and a 4 claw bath tub. We rounded off our visit with an excellent breakfast at the Parlour and walked away happy.

Reviews.Title: “Rare Colonial Splendour”
Reviews.Author: bowendips
Reviews.Content: We've been fortunate to have lived in Hong Kong for the last few years but, sadly, have just left. We decided to spend our last night in a special hotel and we considered the usual options - Peninsula, Mandarin Oriental, Conrad etc - and had we chosen one of them they would, I'm sure, have been excellent. But we decided that we didn't want big and impersonal, however good, and opted instead for Hullett House Hotel. It's part of 1881 Heritage in the former Marine Police headquarters - a rare thing in Hong Kong where redevelopment seldom means anything other than knocking down old and replacing with new. The building is grand colonial and we had eaten at some of the restaurants and drunk in some of the bars. There are just ten very large rooms in the hotel which open onto a wonderful terrace. Despite the featureless Cultural Centre opposite blocking the Harbour from view, there is still a glimpse of the magical skyline of Hong Kong Island. We chose the Stanley suite as we wanted something soothing rather than the sensory overload of the decor in some of the rooms, and it was perfect. The bathroom, like the bedroom, was massive with a wonderful bath and separate rainforest shower. Service was faultless. We had a problem with hot water which was corrected immediately. With just ten rooms it is very quiet and we hardly saw any other guests. This wouldn't suit everyone but it was just what we needed after a frantic few weeks. Location is great, a short walk from the Star Ferry and from Tsim Sha Tsui underground station and right beside Harbour City shopping centre - with prices a bit less eye-watering than those in most of the shops in 1881. Access is a bit unusual. The entrance is on Kowloon Park Drive from where you take a lift to the reception. Someone came down to collect our baggage but it did take a little while. When you're not checking in or out you can enter through 1881. Hullett House is very different to the other 5 star offerings in Hong Kong. We found it the ideal escape for the hustle and bustle and will definitely stay again when we're back in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionnal hotel made for lifetime memories!”
Reviews.Author: Richard79087
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our honeymoon and it couldn't have been a better place to live: the hotel is the oldest building of HK and now a superb boutique hotel which has kept all the charm of its history and heritage, while being very modern and artistic in its interior design. Huge rooms/suites, terrace, it is extremely quiet, you feel transported a century ago thinking you are a King and a Queen! The bed and huge room and high ceiling was a dream, in a word: a dream! On top of that, it is perfectly located right next to ferry going to Central and at 30 seconds to HK shopping center, and 2mn from Tsim Sha Tsui subway. We went to the French restaurant on the first evening which is pure refinement in atmosphere, food and service. Breakfast were also top notch! This hotel shall definitely be 'The' hotel in HK: it offers such a different perspective and feeling than other 'standard/branded' 5*hotels. Go for it you'll be amazed!

Reviews.Title: “Complete waste of money. Absolutely terrible. Worst hotel experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: kssahni
Reviews.Content: All suite marketing is false as they are large rooms, not suites. management is completely confused an the service is terrible. refused to recognize my leaders club card and give me the amenities. Rude staff. should not be a leading hotel under any circumstances. no 24 hr room service. things don't work. internet painfully slow internet. Rubbish hotel at exorbitant prices.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Waughn
Reviews.Content: Do you know the feeling of waking up in a hotel room and not remembering “where” you are? Do you also hate the generic look of hotels that leave you wondering “why” you bother travelling at all, for the rooms all look and feel the same? – I most certainly do! Last time I came to Hong Kong, we wanted something “different”, so we stayed at the "Hullett House" boutique hotel. It’s an exclusive boutique hotel located inside the former Marine Police headquarters, cleverly restored without sacrificing any of its former glory I suspect. We were particularly charmed by the pigeon holes in the court yard, which used to house carrier pigeons. (The manager explained all this to us while he gave us the "grand tour" of this amazing building. There's so much history; I never knew this about Hong Kong...) Best of all, you’re right in the heart of this vibrant city. And while being touched by the ancient history, you remain thankfully untouched by the noise and madness that is Tsimshatsui. The hotel has a selection of spacious suites, each of which are completely different, representing a different period in Hong Kong's history. We chose the suite called “Shek O”. The splendid and somewhat sinfully decadent decor, paired with the superb service really brought back the magic of travel that we've been missing for so long. The suite we had gave us a stunning view of the Hong Kong skyline from your own private balcony (already this feature made our stay worthwhile). Their staff was utterly charming and the manager really went out of his way to help us book the perfect table for a special occasion at one of their lovely restaurants, the “St. George” (an excellent choice, by the way!). I can honestly recommend this hotel; it made our last stay in Hong Kong just this much more special.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, WOW, WOW”
Reviews.Author: Swisswifey
Reviews.Content: I used to live in HK and went back for a trip to see friends with my husband. We'd stayed in most of the other hotels on the island at some point so decided to treat ourselves to a stay at the new Hullett House. We stayed for 6 nights and swapped rooms halfway through for a change. All the rooms are decorated differently and all have balconies with views of HK island. The rooms are really luxurious and the beds super comfy..so much so I overslept and almost missed breakfast twice - luckily breakfast runs till 11.30.... The hotel is amazingly well decorated and the staff are fabulous. The breakfast is probably the best scrambled eggs I have ever had... We invited some friends to have Sunday brunch with us there and they loved it too. The brunch is with free flow champagne and the choice of foods is actually too much. I had trouble saving space for the desserts..... esp as there was a really good cheese board. If you are in Hong Kong get a room at this place - even for just one night. Its a great location to the Star Ferry and Aqua restaurant which is one of my fave places too !!

HotelInfo.Name: Hullett House
HotelInfo.Address: No.1881 Heritage, 2A Canton Road,Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
